result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary L Niblett

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Defendant Gary L Niblett appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Gary L Niblett. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Atty Kershek  states he is newly appointed on this case and does not have the discovery or an offer and requests an adjournment in about 45 days. No objection by the State. The State notes that discovery has been sent so Atty Kershek should be receiving it soon.  Court adjourns for further proceedings. Defendant may appear by zoom for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to Appear filed by Attorney Kershek

3:18 PM Defendant Gary L Niblett in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr., as a friend of the court, in court for Gary L Niblett.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. Defendant to have access to his property to obtain bail.
Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
